Articles.Content: In KSP, if you install a mod, it's in every save. My suggestion is to implement a system that toggles mods on or off for each save file separately. Space Engineers have got a great system that works like that.

That could be a good idea. But KSP mods are not in workshop like SE. What makes SE possible remembering mods for each save file. But when i install new mods or change them. I just create new safe file and never return.

But you can kind of do that right now. Just save ckan file for each save and load them when you want play those.

Of course, i am pretty sure that is possible make mod for ksp which do this. But i dont think that  squad should focus on this. This could be change to curse making their mod manager good.

Essentially undoable, given the way everything loads.  All mods, code, images, textures are loaded before you get to the menu.  And given that Module Manager actually modifies configs, it just isn't doable.  If you remove one mod, everything needs to be reloaded.
